intro: Luzula forsteri subsp. flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of pale green to white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Luzula forsteri subsp. flaccida is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
